page.title: 09<<<<Chilton Village Hall>>>>
page.content: /////////////////////////////////////// The building of the new village hall was started in 1982 and was completed by 1983.The old village hall,which had been in existence since 1920 was pulled down in 1980. Mrs.Clarke of Blewbury, District Councillor for the area,got a grant of 30,000 pounds from the County Council and without this Chilton would not have had a new hall. The builders were Campbells of Wantage, and the concrete and wooden building was designed by architect Alan Turner. Parking is available at the hall,and it is used for Women's Institute meetings, dancing classes, discos, meetings, keep-fit sessions, wedding receptions, etc.Hiring the hall costs about 1 pound 50 pence per hour for local people and 2 to 3 pounds an hour for outside users. ///////////////////////////////////////
